raw_comment:
Hi, We are a third grade class from Juneau, AK, and we are learning how to read infographics. 

We noticed: 
- This map did not show AK or HI. :( 
- The title told us this graphic was about leafs falling.
- The first leave appearances moved from south to north (mostly). 
- May leaf appearances were very spread out and small. 
- February has 28 days. 

We wondered: 
- Why there were so many colors? 
- When the first leaf appearance is for AK and HI? 
- Why does May look the way it does? 

A catchy title we thought of was "As the Leafs grow." 

Thank you for reading our thoughts!!
ace_sentences: We are a third grade class from Juneau in Alaska.
We learn how to read infographics.
This map does not show Alaska.
This map does not show Hawaii.
The title says that this graphic is about leaves falling.
The first leaf appearances moved from south to north in most cases.
The leaf appearances in May were very spread out.
The leaf appearances in May were small.
We wonder why there are many colors.
We wonder when the first leaf appearance is for Alaska.
We wonder when the first leaf appearance is for Hawaii.
We wonder why May looks like this.
We thought of a catchy title.
The catchy title is: As the Leafs grow.
